Key Match Events: Orlando Magic guard Jalen Suggs left Friday's 106-97 victory over the Toronto Raptors in a wheelchair after suffering a back injury.
Suggs attempted a steal and landed awkwardly on the court, leading to back spasms and his eventual exit from the game.
Rookie forward Tristan da Silva stepped up in Suggs' absence, leading the team in scoring with 25 points.
Goga Bitadze almost recorded a triple-double, contributing 11 points, 13 rebounds, and seven assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Magic coach Jamahl Mosley mentioned that Jalen Suggs was in a lot of pain and will be re-evaluated Saturday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Magic have been affected by multiple injuries, with Paolo Banchero and Franz Wagner missing significant time with oblique injuries, Moe Wagner out for the season due to a torn ACL, and Anthony Black and Gary Harris also out due to respective back and hamstring injuries.
